meanings.definition: A raised level surface on which people or things can stand.
meanings.sent1: The workers stood on the platforms to reach the high shelves.
meanings.sent2: The concert stage was a large platform for the musicians to perform on.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the platform was a perfect spot to watch the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The platform of the train station was bustling with commuters rushing to catch their trains.
meanings.sent5: The diving platform at the pool was painted in bright colors to attract swimmers.

meanings.definition: A declaration of the principles on which a group of persons stands.
meanings.sent1: The political party released their platform outlining their goals for the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: The company's platform emphasized transparency and accountability in all business dealings.
meanings.sent3: The platform of the student council promised longer lunch breaks and more school events.
meanings.sent4: The platform of the charity organization aimed to provide aid to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The platform of the environmental group focused on promoting sustainable practices in the community.
